AWKWARD.Defintion: difficult to use, do, or deal with

BOOMING.Defintion: experiencing a period of fast growth

BUSINESS MODEL.Defintion: a description of the different parts of a business or organisation showing how they will work together successfully to make money

BYPASS.Defintion: to avoid something by going around it

CHANGE.Defintion: the money that is returned to someone who has paid for something that costs less than the amount that they gave

COMMISSION.Defintion: a payment to someone who sells goods that is directly related to the amount sold, or a system that uses such payments

COMMISSIONS.Defintion: a payment to someone who sells goods that is directly related to the amount sold, or a system that uses such payments

CONSTRAINTS.Defintion: something that controls what you do by keeping you within particular limits

CONVENIENCE.Defintion: anything that is easy to use and makes life comfortable

DINE-IN.Defintion: eating inside a restaurant, as opposed to take-away

ENTICE.Defintion: to persuade someone to do something by offering them something pleasant

FEASIBLE.Defintion: able to be made, done, or achieved

FIXED COSTS.Defintion: a cost such as wages, rent, and interest that does not change in relation to how much a business produces

GET RID OF.Defintion: to sack or dismiss, to terminate a contract

GLUTEN-FREE.Defintion: a protein that is contained in wheat and some other grains

INCENTIVES.Defintion: something that encourages a person to do something

INTENSE.Defintion: extreme and forceful or (of a feeling) very strong

MARGINS.Defintion: the profit made on a product or service

MINIMUM WAGE.Defintion: the smallest amount of money that employers are legally allowed to pay someone who works for them

MODEL.Defintion: a description of the different parts of a business or organisation showing how they will work together successfully to make money

PRINCIPLE.Defintion: a basic idea or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works

PROFITABLE.Defintion: making or likely to make a profit, (of a business) having larger revenues than costs

RACE TO THE BOTTOM.Defintion: a situation in which companies compete with each other to reduce costs by paying the lowest wages or giving workers the worst conditions

RELIANT.Defintion: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone

SELLING POINT.Defintion: a characteristic of a product that will persuade people to buy it

SICK PAY.Defintion: money given by an employer to someone who cannot work because of illness

SQUEEZED.Defintion: to press something firmly, especially from all sides in order to change its shape, reduce its size, or remove liquid from it

SUSTAINABLE.Defintion: able to continue over a period of time

THANKLESS.Defintion: A thankless job is difficult or unpleasant, and people do not thank you for it

TRAILER.Defintion: a box on wheels that is pulled by a car and is used for taking things from one place to another

UNPREDICTABLE.Defintion: likely to change suddenly and without reason and therefore not able to be predicted (= expected before it happens) or depended on

VIABLE.Defintion: able to be done or likely to succeed

WIN-WIN.Defintion: A win-win situation or result is one that is good for everyone who is involved
